posts.message:
as we all know, you can't make cross-domain AJAX calls with jQuery, or any other alternative library.
this is due to a concept called "same origin policy", and BTW this is a browser-level implementation, not with the technology that is being used.

this plugin will fix this behavior in a VERY smart way, and will let you do this with ease.
Give it a try, and let me know if you faced any problems.
BTW, I've faced a problem when calling some Arabic content due to charset incompatibility, I've fixed this plugin to support Arabic and other non-Latin characters.

I will post it and let you know soon ISA.
posts.caption: james.padolsey.com
posts.description: Chris Heilmann recently posted on how to use YQL to make cross-domain requests, which would usually be prohibited due to the same-domain-policy. I already knew about YQL, but I had no idea that it allowed retrieval of HTML from other sites, via JSON, returned as a single string!

posts.description: وقف حائراً أمام أنواع المواصلات المختلفة التى احتشدت أمامه، وتعالى أصوات سائقيها منادياً على الأماكن التى تمر بها، حزم أمره وقرر ركوب "الأتوبيس" المتجه إلى شارع "عباس العقاد" بحى مدينة نصر، فهو بحسب خبرته بطرق القاهرة المزدحمة أمامه حوالى نصف ساعة للوصول من "السيدة عائشة"، وبذلك يستطيع اللحاق بموعده...
